text: A National mosque are Mosques that represent the Cultural Identity of Muslim- Majority countries and the image of the same country or a particular Islamic nation respectively. == National mosques == Country Mosque name and Description City Picture Ref. Baitul Mukarram: Nationalized mosque. It is the 10th largest mosque in the world, accommodating more than 40,000 people Dacca Thariani and Co: Architects and Engineers. Booklet in section under projects completed "mosques". Al-Azhar Mosque: National Mosque. Cairo Al-Aqsa Mosque: National Palestinian mosque East Jerusalem Faisal Mosque: Named for Faisal of Saudi Arabia, it is the largest mosque in Pakistan and Southern Asia and one of the largest mosques in the world respectively. Islamabad National Mosque Masjid al-Qiblatayn: Historically important for Muslims as it is the place where, after the Islamic prophet Muhammad received the command to change the direction of prayer (qibla) from Jerusalem to Mecca. Medina Jama Masjid: The largest mosque in India. Also known as Masjid-i Jahān-Numā after Shah Jahan Old Delhi ==Related pages== * Islam * Mosque ==References== mosque Category:Religion-related lists
title: List of mosques
